chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: In CSS, there is a very important property called Position.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Suppose you want to move an element from its previous position,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: then you can use position relative to create a top 3 pixel and that 3 pixel will come down.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Similarly, by using position property and z-index, you can keep the elements on top of each other.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: How all these things are done in CSS?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: In this video, we are going to understand.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Do write Sigma Batch O in the comment section below.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And keep this high energy.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Let's go to the computer screen.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Let's roll the intro.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: In CSS, position property is very important.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So I will make a folder named video28 and show you.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Let's name it video28.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And after that you will know how important position property is and what can happen with it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So as always, I will make a boilerplate template.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And after making a boilerplate template, I will simply write CSS position here.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I will put a style tag here so that I can style the elements.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I will put 3 boxes here.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I put 4.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Box1, I gave one class, I will give one box2 class, I will give one box3 class, I will give one box4 class.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I will give one box class to all of them.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So that if I want to do something with all the boxes, I can do it by dot box.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So here I will simply say dot box, border, border, 2px solid black.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I reset CSS by putting margin 0, padding 0 on the universal selector.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: You must know this, if you know me a little bit.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: This is my habit that I select the universal selector and put margin 0, padding 0.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So if I see this now, I didn't see it and I want to know the reason for this.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: The reason for this is that we have not given height and width to each box.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So let's give it a height and width of 133 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And let's give it a width too.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I am going to give it a width of 80vw.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now that we know how our sizing units work.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Along with that, I would like to give padding to all the boxes.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I will give padding 3 pixels from all sides.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I will also give margin 3 pixels from all sides.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So what will happen with this, the boxes will look something like this.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now I will be able to target box 1, box 2, box 3, box 4 individually.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: But let's do one thing, first of all, I will get you access to a playlist.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Or click and ask for a book or click and save, which you will do right now.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And along with that, I want you to open it in the browser.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So as you saw here, our browser has prepared all our boxes by doing margin, padding and everything.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If you want, you can also write box 1, box 2 here.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: But I think that's fine.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Let's leave it like this for now.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now what I will do is I will write dot box 1 here.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I will add some CSS to it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I will say this work for box 2, box 3, box 4.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I will put the background color in box 1 with the letter.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Similarly, we will put a background color in box 2, any random.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And the background color of box 3, we put this with the letter.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I will make the background color purple.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So you saw here, we got 4 boxes like this.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now what is by default, the position of all the boxes is static.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Position is a property in CSS, which is by default static.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And the meaning of static position is that top, bottom, left, right, z-index cannot be written on it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now you will say what is top, bottom, left, right?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now if I put top 2 pixels on it, then Chrome is telling me that

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Position static property prevents top from having an effect.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If you keep any position other than static, then you can enjoy this property.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So how to enjoy this property, this is what I want to tell you now.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So see, if I do not use position property in it,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: That is, its by default position is static, then what will be the behavior?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: First the top box will come, then this box will come, then this box will come,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: The bottom box will come, and then the last box will come.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Typical CSS behavior that I will expect.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Let us say that I put the absolute position of the bottom box.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So you understood the meaning of position static.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Position static means that it will remain where it was, it will not have any effect.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now after this, there is an absolute position, there is a relative.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Before absolute, I will tell you what relative positioning is.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now assume that I say to box 2, put its position relative.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: What should I do? Relative.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Relative does not mean relative here, relative means that

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I can move it from its place and now I can put top bottom properties in it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If I say top 3 pixels, the more I increase, the more it will go down.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: You see, it came above it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: The more I increase, the more it will go down.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: The rest of the elements will not matter, I can move this element from its place.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So if I want it to go up a little and if I want it to go a little to the left,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I say left 34 pixels, then the distance from the left to here will be 34 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I will increase it as much as I want.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So what happened is that it got stacked on this box.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Our CN box is stacked on it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Its color is not CN, I guess its color is Aqua.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So it came on the Aqua box.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now assume for some reason you want my Aqua box should not be down,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: my Aqua box should come up, this box should come behind it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So we can set the value of Z-index.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If I set the value of Z-index here, let's say,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: it will not make any difference.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So what I have to do is put position relative in it, then Z-index will work.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I will come to this later why we have put position relative here.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: But as soon as I give it position relative, I can set its Z-index.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If I give it 1, it should not be 0, it should be 1.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If it has more than this, then it will come up.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now we have put position relative because whenever you want to use Z-index,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: then you have to remove the position property and give some position.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: This is the rule to set Z-index.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Here we have not used the top bottom, so it will not make any difference by putting position relative.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Its position will be set.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And its position is set, means there is another position after removing static,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: because of which I can put Z-index on it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If I remove Z-index, then it will go behind.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So the static position is by default property, you know this.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Position static will be seen in your CSS?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Yes, sometimes we use it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Suppose I want to reset its position, I want it to be relative.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So reset it when a media query comes,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: that is, whenever we resize it, I will tell you in the upcoming videos.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I just want to tell you that we sometimes write and set position static in JavaScript.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: But forgetting all those things, we come to the point.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: We saw position static, we saw position relative.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: You can use top, bottom, left, right if you have put position relative.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So if I reload it, nothing will happen because we were writing all these CSS here,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: which goes away after refreshing.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So here I quickly write top 34 pixels and bottom let us say 56 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And you see, from top and in fact, I have to write left here.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Left or right, either I will set top or bottom, I will do one of these two.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So here you see, top 34 pixels, left 56 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: You see, I gave it from top, I gave it from left.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So I hope you understand this thing.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If I want to set the Z-index of other boxes, then I will have to put position in it.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: But now I let it stay like this.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So this came on top of it, you can see the box.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So this was the position.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now I want to tell you what happens by absolute position.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So what I will do is first of all, I will give a parent to all our boxes.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: That is, all of these will come inside a parent div.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So here I have given a parent div by class is equal to parent.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Let us say in this parent div, I want to write some styles.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If dot parent and I want to give some padding in it, let us say 3 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I would like to give margin, let us say 34 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And I make it 43 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And here I give a border of 2 pixels solid purple.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Let us keep this much for now.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And you can see that there is a parent box in which all our other boxes are kept.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So now what I will do is give it a position.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I will give it to our box 1, I will give it position absolute.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: What will happen by giving position absolute?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: By giving position absolute, it will seem that this element,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: see I gave it position absolute, it has become that this element is not in the normal document flow.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So this was my box 2, to which I had given position relative.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I would like to end its position relative once, just to explain to you what is position absolute.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So now you have to understand what will happen when I will absolute any position.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: When I absolute its position, then what will it do?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I have made its position absolute, then it will not do anything.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: But as soon as I said position absolute top 0 pixels,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: you see what it will do now, it has gone to the top in viewport.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: You can see what it will do, it will find its parent and say,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: parent, are you a positioned element?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Understand this carefully, what did I say?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: What did I do? Listen to me carefully, forget everything, whatever you were thinking,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: now look carefully at the screen.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Div, which is box 1, in that I gave position absolute.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: As soon as absolute position is applied in this and top 0 pixels are applied,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: now it will try to find out whose 0 pixels are relative.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So what will it do? It will find its parent.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: It will ask its parent, dad, are you a positioned element?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Its dad will say, wait, I will see and come.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: It will see that there is no position in my class, my position is static.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So it will say, dad, bye then.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Then it will say, grandfather, who is its grandfather?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: It will say, body, grandfather, are you a positioned element?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: It will say no, then it will go to its dad.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: It will say, but grandfather, are you a positioned element?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: It will say, I am not a positioned element, but there is no one above me,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: so you are my relative here.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: It will say, okay, so its relative will be 0 pixels from the top.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So whose relative is this?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Nearest positioned ancestor.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So what does position mean?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Position is static, something else.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now you see here, if you don't understand what its parent is, then listen again.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Here I have made the position absolute, made the top 0 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If I increase the top, then it comes like this.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If I make the left 0, add one more here,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: and I say, bro, let the left also become 0.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So here the left is relative to HTML 0.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So here you can see that the left has become 0.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Now what will I do?

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: If I increase the left like this,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: then you can see here that it is going here,

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: because this is the distance of 144 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: And the top 8 pixels means it is 8 pixels from here.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: So the top is 8 pixels, the left is 144 pixels.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: I hope you understood what I am saying.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: When I made the position absolute, I will make it 8 pixels from the top.

chunks.title: CSS Position Property  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #28.mp4
chunks.text: Because it has decided that it will move relative to HTML.
